attributes.action: Stop Animal Testing!
attributes.background:
No animal should be harmed, hurt or killed for cosmetics. We want the government to introduce a law which will ban testing on animals.

For More information visit:
http://talk-about-testing.blogspot.co.uk/
attributes.additional_details:
For more information visit:
http://talk-about-testing.blogspot.co.uk/

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-experiment-on/
http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-experiment-on/alternatives-animal-testing/

attributes.action: Call for a new General Election.
attributes.background: In light of the Conservative governments failure to reduce the national debt, the county feels they are not competent enough to lead our nation. Local councils are falling apart,  the NHS is in crisis,  the most vulnerable are being penalised while making financial gains to the top 1%!
attributes.additional_details:
According to the latest official figures, public debt has increased by £555 billion since 2010.

Public debt now stands at 89.4% of our national income (GDP), up from 78.4% when then the Tories came to power in 2010.

Every budget has seen a U turn and the house of Lords have time and time again blocked unfair measures being introduced.  Once the current Governnent get a result they don't like then they bully through the measures anyway. 

The nation's trust in this government has vanished.

attributes.action: Make it law that all vehicles have to be fitted with a lifehammer.
attributes.background: After hearing the awful tragedy of the family who lost their lives as their car went off the pier in Buncrana, it stresses the importance a lifehammer or emergency hammer could have on saving lives. They cost barely anything. They break the glass windows in emergencies allowing people to escape.
attributes.additional_details: Many vehicles already have life hammers fitted Including Buses and plant machinery. But cars do not. Lifehammers or emergency hammers could save lives. Car window glass is almost impossible to break with just human force alone, especially when you only have a limited time to do it. So please help to make having a lifehammer or emergency hammer in your vehicle a law. It really could save lives.

attributes.action: Move the Westminster Government at least 100 miles further North, permanently.
attributes.background: Moving the seat of government out of the UK's richest enclave would make MPs think differently about all of the country.  It would put thousands of highly-paid supporting jobs where costs are lower and whose local economy would benefit from a boost, and impact London House prices favourably.
attributes.additional_details:
Presently even the leadership of the Northern Powerhouse is 97% in London (Guardian, 7/3/16).

The forthcoming, very costly refurbishment means the Westminster government will need at least a temporary home. Other worthy petitions call for it to be 'outside London'. This one calls for permanent relocation, a clear and 'pychological' distance to the North of London. The physical Houses of Parliament could be refurbished with a view to some other use.

attributes.action: All plastic packaging produced by supermarkets must be made to be recyclable
attributes.background: There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: Stop making cuts to the NHS mental health service.
attributes.background:
More people have started suffering from mental health issues.
The majority are desperate for help, but when they reach out there is nothing there.
Suicide rates are increasing due to thinking there is no hope.
If the NHS keeps cutting funding for mental health support this will just get worse.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Include Feminism as part of the primary and/or secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: As a female sixth form student, I have come across few male peers who fully understand feminism. Many refuse to accept that gender inequality is still an issue both nationally and globally, and see feminists as man-hating groups advocating female superiority. This ignorance must be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: If people were made aware and given a full understanding of Feminism and gender inequality from a young age, they would be far more tuned in to these issues in adult life. This would be effective in helping society to become more equal and tolerant in terms of gender, which would benefit everyone, including men. The main factor inhibiting the achievement of gender equality appears to be a general ignorance of the fact that inequality exists. The way to address this ignorance is education.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in front of children, or in rooms which they use
attributes.background: Adults who smoke in front of children, especially inside a house are neglecting the health of that child. Smoke also hangs around on furniture / walls / curtains, making it an unhealthy environment for the child. Smoking in front of a child should be illegal and deemed as child neglect

attributes.action: Ensure road cyclists pay a tax and adhere to a DVLA type set of rules
attributes.background:
Taxing cyclists who are over the age of 18 £30 a year would generate £130m+ per year which can be used for cycle lane projects and improving the roads.

With this tax, cyclists should also be made to followe a DVLA type set of rules when on the roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The tax would generate over £130m+ a year which could be used to improve roads for cyclalcists and help with cycle lane projects.

The DVLA type rules would also help reduce the amount of road accidents involving cyclists. Currently 48% of all cyclists feel unsafe when out on the roads. These new rules will help both cyclists and other road users make better choices when it comes to scenarios involving cyclists.

Do the right thing for Britain - sign this petition.

attributes.action: Review Government plans to force all maintained schools to become academies.
attributes.background: In light of concerns expressed by Ofsted Chief Inspector, Sir Michael Wilshaw and chairman of the Local Government Association’s children and young people board, Councillor Roy Perry, is it right to push through this agenda so hastily?
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent Guardian article, Councillor Perry is quoted as saying that 82% of council-maintained schools are rated as good or outstanding by Ofsted and that 15% of the largest academy chains perform above the national average in terms of pupil progress, compared with 44% of council-run schools.

Guardian article: http://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/mar/15/every-english-school-to-become-an-academy-ministers-to-announce

Sir Michael Wilshaw expresses concerns about academy results and finances: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

attributes.action: Debate MPs disrespect for the Speaker & leader of the opposition.
attributes.background: John Bercow's failure to call the House to order, during Government bench MP disorder during Jeremy Corbyn's contributions, calls into question MPs & Speaker's respect for behavioural responsibilities of MPs, evidenced in the video link: https://www.facebook.com/PigGateuk/videos/516561248515067/
attributes.additional_details:
The following links to media coverage, evidence the significant journalistic & public concern over MP behaviour & failed cognisance of acceptable conduct within the House, which compromise the Speaker's management of MPs who openly display disrespect within the House & in particular to the leader of the opposition & opposition MPs.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newsvideo/uk-politics-video/8636865/Order-How-Speaker-of-the-House-of-Commons-John-Bercow-fails-to-keep-control-of-the-children.html

attributes.action: Urge India to end abuse Human Rights abuse and initiate a peaceful dialogue
attributes.background:
Recent use of pellet guns on Kashmiri protestors has caused blindness of more than 150 people mostly children and 60 deaths.
Kashmir is under curfew and serious restrictions imposed on normal daily life for 45 days.
Indian refuses to initiate a dialogue
attributes.additional_details:
1. Sir Henry Harding, Governor General on behalf of the British sold Kashmir in 1846 to the Maharaja of Punjab Gulab Singh for 7,500,000 Indian Rupees who then gave it away as a dowry to his son in law Maharaja Hari Singh!
2. British citizensof Kashmiri origin have relatives, near and dear one suffering from the atrocities
3. Kashmir issue is the main flash point between the two nuclear powers, India and Pakistan. Violence only breads violence and plays in the hands of foreign agencies.

attributes.action: Change the law all assets to be sold/split equally when a relationship ends.
attributes.background: Current law allows the parent remaining with the kids to remain in the family home till the youngest turns 18. Leaving the other parent potentially homeless. The law needs to change so that the when separation/divorce happens all assets should be sold/divided equally allowing both to move on
attributes.additional_details: I am currently living with family as I can not afford nor get help with housing. I share my kids so when I have them I rely on family to put me and my kids up. This is extremely unfair on all. I am not the first nor will I be the last to find myself in this situation. Most people will know of someone having the same issue as myself. Mediation/solicitors/court costs if the law was changed so that when a couple separate/divorce all assets should be sold/divided equally it would save time and money

attributes.action: The law protecting seagulls in the UK needs to be changed or suspended.
attributes.background: In recent years, the population of seagulls has increased to the point where they are more than just a nuisance. Adults and children have been attacked as these scavengers have become the rats by the sea. Food is not safe anywhere outdoors and this is affecting local businesses and residents.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed or suspended so that people can protect themselves and their property, and the Government must also consider a humane cull of some sort.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: Create special funding for the victims of racial hatred & bigotry postreferendum
attributes.background: After the brexit referendum was won, there has been a nasty upsurge in racial attacks & xenophobia in general.  We need to create special funding for the victims of this vile abuse, whether it be for counselling or repairs, whatever their needs. Also we need to ensure police resources to combat it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-devon-36737529
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075
https://secure.avaaz.org/en/petition/MPs_also_the_PM_David_Cameron_Provide_additional_funding_for_victims_of_hate_crimes/edit/

insurmountable evidence that there was was a latent problem & this referendum result has validated these bigot. So now we need to help drive it down into the cracks & crevices again.

attributes.action: The Government  inaugurates a system to record all entry and exit to Britain.
attributes.background: It is becoming obvious that it is only fair to allow existing migrants to stay provided they are contributing but this must NOT include new migrants since Brexit has been decided upon.  The Government must insist that all subsequent visitors/migrants have passports with biometric information within.
attributes.additional_details: All new British Passports issued have a 'chip' embedded and many other Countries too have biometric information which is essential for proper registration of those entering and leaving Britain.  It has been used to great effect in the US and Britain must have the same security measures.  Such a requirement should not be seen as discriminatory by the EU as British Citizens are required to have the same information.  Mrs May has failed to install a system as Home Secretary and must rectify as PM.

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: Allow U.K. expatriates to vote in the E.U. referendum
attributes.background:
Current law prevents expatriates who have been 'ordinarily non resident' - as defined by HMRC - from voting in any U.K. election.
This inspite of the fact that a vast majority are expatriates due to employment, family or health reasons. They are also required to submit U.K. tax returns.
attributes.additional_details: Incarcerated criminals are currently denied the vote in the U.K. Are expats classed as criminals?

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption. It's destroying families, our children are not your profit
attributes.background: We need a full investigation on how SS work taking children from their mum when no acutal harm has come to their child, however they say that there 'could be potential harm'. It costs more to adopt out then to keep the baby with the mother, something needs to be done, our children are at risk.
attributes.additional_details: forced adoption happens in secret family courts, a council are given a target to meet on how many babies/children they need to adopt to get bonuses. John hemming, a known mp who knows all about this matter and sees the doings. Understandingly I know ss have the duty of care to a child I don't disputes that but ever since baby p (bless hes soul) mothers that wouldn't put their babies at harm are paying the price or living the consequences of how you had a bad up bringing

attributes.action: Pay volunteer carers the national minimum wage with full employment rights.
attributes.background:
Official figures have estimated that unpaid carers save the government £162 bn per yr. The cost of a local authority providing the same level of in home care is avrg £17.20 per hr.
The threshold for someone claiming carers allowance is a min of 35hrs per week @ £62,10 that is £1.77p per hr !
attributes.additional_details: Many carers have to give up jobs and careers in order to do a job that the local authority should be doing and get little or no thanks and support. Full time carers should be at least entitled to the minimum wage and statutory holidays with replacement care provided by local authorities. Anything less than this is just slave labour with the government taking unfair advantage of an unrecognized, unapreciated and valuable work force that, last year, paid for the NHS budget

attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Make pet shops pass a test before selling their animals
attributes.background: Many pet shops are giving the wrong advice about their animals, especially exotics, to first time owners and unfortunately they don't know it could be harming their pet. Pet shops should pass a test on each animal they sell to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
The main issues are:
The wrong food 
Incorrect housing size/type
Incorrect size/type wheels (wire ones injure feet)
Telling people solitary animals "need a friend"
Incorrect bedding type (usually sawdust which is avoided by most people)
Failing to tell customers that CAPTIVE BRED ANIMALS SHOULD NOT BE RELEASED INTO THE WILD

attributes.action: Raise awareness and increase funding for Mental Health.
attributes.background: Mental Health is a significant issue in the UK. Around 25% of all UK citizens experience mental illness, and almost a third of children in education will experience it. It is a silent issue that many feel embarrassed to discuss. Our aim is to raise support for those who experience mental illness.
attributes.additional_details: We (National Citizen Service) are currently aiming to work in association with a charity called 'Mind' who are currently supporting around 375,000 people, which is drastically less than the 25% that come forward regarding their mental illness.

attributes.action: Compulsory dyslexia tests in schools
attributes.background: At the moment there aren't compulsory tests for dyslexia in primary schools so thousands of children struggle through their school life without knowing that they have it. This needs to change so that they can receive support and advice to help them.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics into the Key Stage 3 & 4 curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that politics should be an evenly taught subject with the objective to inform learners of what policies the current government have in place and the effect these can have on the country. Also to avoid being mislead by any inaccurate advertising by any campaign.
attributes.additional_details: "£350 million a week goes to the EU, let's put that into the NHS" - Misleading to those without an understanding of what the £350 million actually goes on.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Reverse the Mortgage Interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords
attributes.background: Thousands of buy-to-let landlords will see their earnings hit after George Osborne cracked down on mortgage interest tax relief in his summer Budget.

attributes.action: Increase payment for Early Years Education Funding
attributes.background: As a self funded Pre School and with the rising wage costs along with upcoming work pensions we along with many other pre schools are finding sustainably impossible. Funding that we rely on has not increased to cover these costs. We fear closure leading to no places for children in the future.
attributes.additional_details: We have to have a certain amount of staff per group of children who all need to be paid at least the minimum wage. We are self funded. Incoming money funds staff costs, rent, phone, equipment & resources, HMRC, Ofsted, insurances, food etc. Cash flow forecasts shows we will not be able to sustain provision in the near future if funding is not increased, leaving children without a place and parents without childcare & staff without an income.

attributes.action: Work permit for Indian restaurant skilled staff crisis
attributes.background: The Indian restaurant trade is dying due to lack of staff we need the government to help us bring skilled staff to restaurant trade to survive. Look at introducing work permits again
attributes.additional_details: Limit the amount of work permit per restaurant to limit abuse

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to report on the accuracy of MPs' public statements.
attributes.background: The EU referendum highlighted the damage that can be caused by false & misleading information. We the undersigned propose that an independent panel should be established to report to the public on the validity and accuracy of MPs' public comments.
attributes.additional_details: At the heart of democracy is clear information sharing & communication. MPs should therefore be held to account for the validity of information they share. We advise that the Independent Panel will assess MPs' comments upon request from the public. Each comment could be assessed as to whether it is factually correct/incorrect, verifiable/unverifiable, or misleadingly presented. There could be sanctions for repeat offenders of misleading information & an 'honesty' league table of MPs.

attributes.action: EEA naturalisation and permanent residency applications .
attributes.background: Grant no changes to the application for naturalisation or permanent residency under the EEA regulations for the 5 years from the date of referendum .

attributes.action: Implement RSPCA approved standards to all UK livestock farms
attributes.background: We must keep adhering to the 5 Freedoms. EU standards require animals to be inspected once a day, sow stalls are still used for the first 4 weeks of pregnancy, meat chickens have avg. 7cm of space (33kg per m² avg. weight 2.4kg), 550cm² for egg laying hens, calves are only put into groups at 8 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
RSPCA welfare standards should be implemented as the standard practice: http://science.rspca.org.uk/sciencegroup/farmanimals/standards
EU law: 
http://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/3818623/eu-law-on-the-welfare-of-farm-animals.pdf
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare#on-farm-animal-welfare

If we can't improve our standards to RSPCA level, it is paramount these animals do not have to endure any more suffering than they already do under EU law. Ideal: CCTV in livestock farms for RSPCA to access

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution
attributes.background: In the wake of the UK's imminent exit from the EU, we need a written Constitution at this time of uncertainty to shape the relationship between the citizens and the state. We need a written Constitution that reflects the values of a modern society that is tolerant, pluralistic and multicultural.
attributes.additional_details: The immediate legal consequences of leaving the EU are far-reaching and uncertain for fundamental rights of UK citizens. We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. The drafting of a new UK Constitution should not be delayed.

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory before being allowed to vote in Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Production of photo ID should be mandatory when voting in Elections and Referendums.
There have been many cases of electoral fraud through personation.
People have turned up to vote only to be turned away because someone has already voted using their name.
It's time this ceased.
attributes.additional_details:
Oldham is one of the worst places in the country for electoral fraud.
Only a few years ago, Oldham was 8th in the country for electoral fraud.
Recently, there were 4 cases of personation.
It is time that production of photo ID was made mandatory for all Elections and Referendums.
This would prevent cases of personation and go some way to creating confidence in our democratic process.
It is time that the production of photo ID was made mandatory in polling stations before anyone can vote.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Government over it's Education policies.
attributes.background:
I would like a vote of no confidence in the Government's Education policies. There is now a crisis in teaching. Too many teachers are leaving the profession and the children and young people of our country are being let down by narrow minded Tories. 
They are failing children, parents and Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
Our children are being failed by the Tory government. 
Students are being forced to do the Ebacc and have their choices limited as a result of the narrowing of the curriculum.
Schools are being forced to be Academies which statistics prove are no better than when we had LEA schools. 
Schools need money to implement new changes and syllabuses yet are given no extra money. What's worse is that leaders of Academy Chains are paid ridiculous sums. Sir Daniel Moynihan takes over £13,000 per Academy!

attributes.action: Change rules for working Carers to hours worked, instead of £110 per week.
attributes.background: At the moment the rules for receiving Carer's Allowance states that you cannot earn more than £110 per week. If the government changed the rules to specify someone in receipt of CA can only work a certain number of hours instead it would be a lot more fair.
attributes.additional_details:
£110 divided by £7.20 (minimum wage) = 15 hours (approx)
£110 divided by £9.50 = 11.5 hours (approx)
Therefore someone on a lower wage is clearly disadvantaged, because they have to work longer hours to earn the weekly allowance.  This then means that the disabled person is disadvantaged by not having their carer present.

If the rules state you can work 15 hours it would be much fairer to all carers.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates
https://www.gov.uk/carers-allowance/eligibility

attributes.action: To make food banks a legal obligation for all supermarkets in the UK.
attributes.background: Food banks play a big part in helping the homeless. Fortunately, some supermarkets have food banks, however there are still many large supermarkets who don't. We want to make a change, and make it policy that all supermarkets provide food banks to give back to the community.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nothing for supermarkets to provide this service, however it will make a huge difference to those in the community who need it.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for Arts subject tuition, for school age children.
attributes.background: Arts education for young people continues to be subject to yearly cuts. Arts tuition outside of school education is costly, but now necessary to provide sufficient learning opportunities for talented children. This is inaccessible to many families. Help end the elitism and value the arts.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government prioritises "core" subjects (Maths, English, Sciences, Language, History Geography) by way of the EBacc performance measure: http://bit.ly/1QiubcJ  Whereas these subjects should be valued, it's at the expense of arts subjects. 

What is being asked here is a small contribution to arts education, that would actually help boost the economy at the same time. The Warwick Commission estimates the arts sector represents 5% of the British economy valued at £76.9bn: http://bit.ly/1EJWbkV

attributes.action: A 5 year ban from public office for politicians who knowingly lie to the public.
attributes.background: The Brexit  debate has frustrated people on both sides. There have been many opinions put forward as facts but there have also been outright lies and some people believed them and are now annoyed. If a citizen said some of these things they would be sued but it seems OK if a politician says them.
attributes.additional_details: £350 million pounds a week will be diverted from the EU to the NHS. 75 million Turks are on their way to Britain.

attributes.action: Remove Southern Railway's Franchise For Causing So Much Chaos & Disruption
attributes.background: Repeated delays and cancellations due to low staff levels has left many late and stranded. With an over complaced complaints procedure, Southern Railway customers have been left out in the cold with slim chances of any compensation.

attributes.action: Seek temporary suspension of EU membership rather than irrevocably leave the EU.
attributes.background:
We, the under 50s who voted overwhelmingly to remain, demand that the future world in which we will have to live is not irrevocably dictated by the leave vote of the over 50s.
Instead, we demand temporary suspension of membership, & a further referendum once the terms of Brexit are clear.
attributes.additional_details:
It is the younger generations that will have to live with the consequences of the EU Referendum. Polls have consistently shown that the under 50s overwhelmingly support remaining in the EU. 
We demand that our future in which we and our children will grow up, train, work, and raise our families, is not permanently and irrevocably dictated by the leave vote of the over 50s against our will.

attributes.action: Introduce Automatic Voter Registration in the UK
attributes.background: In the past few days, people have struggled to register to vote at the 'last minute' - an hour before closing. Every citizen over 18 has the right to do so. We should not be putting an arbitrary barrier in the way and should be making it as easy as possible to register to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
When signing up for a driving licence, we are asked if we would like to join the organ donor register - most 17 year old are asked the question. They could also be provisionally registered to vote at this time with an 'opt out' clause here.
Registration for further licences, e.g. HGVs, could prompt the same option.
Interaction with other government agencies could offer scope for a similar opt out option arrangement - e.g. student loans, pensions, benefits, HMRC

attributes.action: Repeal all legislation that inhibits absolute freedom of speech.
attributes.background: If, as is the case, the British people cannot vocalise or document any or every view that we may hold, then freedom of speech no longer exists. We may not like everything that anyone says or writes but we believe it is their right to say and write what they wish.
attributes.additional_details: One such objectionable piece of legislation is Clause 127 of the  Communications Act 2003.

attributes.action: Change Election Law to Require Full Disclosure of Funding
attributes.background: The OECD, the LSE, and many others have declared their support for remaining in the EU, but the public may not be aware that many of these organisations receive funding from the EU, potentially creating a conflict of interest.  The law should be changed to make voters aware of potential conflicts.
attributes.additional_details:
The OECD, the LSE, and a number of unions have declared their support for remaining in the EU, but the public may not be aware that these organisations receive funding from the EU, potentially creating a conflict of interest.
To avoid this in future, the government should change the law on elections.  Organisations endorsing an institution in a public vote should be required to disclose whether they've received funding from that institution and how much they've had in the preceding 3 years.

attributes.action: Make government responses to petitions more productive.
attributes.background: The responses to petitions started online more often than not simply sustain that "the government is confident it has made the right decision." This is hugely counter-productive in easing the public's concerns over government actions.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that a petition gains the appropriate number of signatures to be responded to, it is clear that a large number of people disagree that the government has made the right decision, and reiterating this statement without any due consideration for why or where the concerns are coming from defeats the object of having this platform for petitions. 
Concerns must be understood and responded to with possible courses of action to improve the situation brought to attention by the petitions.
